results.title: How Alvin Bragg Resurrected the Case Against Donald Trump
results.abstract: A year ago, the investigation into the former president appeared from the outside to be over. But a series of crucial turning points led to this week’s indictment.
results.byline: By Jonah E. Bromwich, Ben Protess and William K. Rashbaum

multimedia.caption: Alvin Bragg, the Manhattan district attorney, leaves his office after a grand jury indicted former President Donald J. Trump over a $130,000 hush-money payment to porn star Stormy Daniels.
multimedia.copyright: Dave Sanders for The New York Times

results.title: Trump’s G.O.P. Rivals, Shielding Him, Reveal Their 2024 Predicament
results.abstract: Many of Donald Trump’s potential opponents snapped into line behind him, showing just how hard it may be to persuade Republican voters to choose an alternative.
results.byline: By Michael C. Bender and Maggie Haberman

multimedia.caption: Rather than use the moment as a political opening, Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida criticized the indictment of former President Donald J. Trump, going so far as to say he would try block his state from helping any extradition.
multimedia.copyright: Jordan Gale for The New York Times

results.title: Indicted and Running for Office? It Didn’t Begin With Trump.
results.abstract: American politics has a long history of candidates who were indicted or convicted of crimes but sought office again.

multimedia.caption: One of the most recent presidential candidates to run while under indictment was Rick Perry, the former governor of Texas, who sought the Republican nomination in the 2016 election.
One of the most recent presidential candidates to run while under indictment was Rick Perry, the former governor of Texas, who sought the Republican nomination in the 2016 election.

results.title: Storms Kill at Least 10 as Tornadoes Tear Through Midwest and South
results.abstract: Tornadoes in Arkansas injured at least 30 people. One person was killed and at least 28 others were hospitalized after a roof collapsed at a theater in Illinois.
results.byline: By Gwen Moritz, McKenna Oxenden, Livia Albeck-Ripka and Mike Ives

results.title: One Dead and Dozens Hurt in Roof Collapse at Illinois Theater
results.abstract: The disaster at a heavy metal concert in Belvidere, Ill., was one of several storm-related episodes that killed at least nine other people as tornadoes tore through the Midwest and South on Friday.
results.byline: By Mike Ives and Robert Chiarito

multimedia.caption: The scene inside the Apollo Theater after its roof collapsed on Friday in Belvidere, Ill.
The scene inside the Apollo Theater after its roof collapsed on Friday in Belvidere, Ill.

results.title: China Draws Lessons From Russia’s Losses in Ukraine, and Its Gains
results.abstract: With an eye on a possible conflict over Taiwan, analysts have scrutinized the war for insights ranging from the importance of supply lines to the power of nuclear threats.
des_facet: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

multimedia.caption: New recruits of the People’s Liberation Army at a send-off ceremony in eastern China. Experts studying Russia’s war have said that Moscow’s manpower shortfall shows that China needed to keep its ground forces strong.

results.title: Espionage Charge Adds Hurdle to Freeing a Reporter Detained in Russia
results.abstract: The Biden administration recently secured the release of two Americans convicted of criminal charges in Russia, but even fabricated charges of spying can raise the stakes.
results.byline: By Michael Crowley, Ivan Nechepurenko and Anton Troianovski

multimedia.caption: Evan Gershkovich, a Wall Street Journal reporter, is accused by Russia of trying to gain illicit information about the country’s “military-industrial complex.”

results.title: Ukraine Charges a Leading Ukrainian Vicar, as Russia Pounds Eastern Ukraine
results.abstract: The charge against the religious leader, Pavlo Lebid, came as Russian forces hit the town of Avdiivka, among 70 other targets, along the front line.
results.byline: By Matthew Mpoke Bigg and Yurii Shyvala

multimedia.caption: Metropolitan Pavlo Lebid at the end of the morning service at the Pechersk Lavra on Thursday. Ukraine’s security service charged Mr. Lebid on Saturday with being in league with Russia and supporting Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine.

results.title: Now Playing in China: Putin-Aligned Artists Shunned in the West
results.abstract: As Russia works to shore up its image and rebuild its soft power after its invasion of Ukraine, it is strengthening cultural ties with friendly nations, including China.

results.title: Caitlin Clark and Iowa Deliver Toppling Upset of South Carolina in Final Four
results.abstract: The Gamecocks were considered a heavy favorite to repeat as champions. But Clark and the Hawkeyes delivered, all the way to the championship game against Louisiana State.
results.byline: By Kris Rhim and Talya Minsberg
org_facet: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

results.title: When Every Win Means Water, Water Everywhere
results.abstract: Hold the champagne. Water has become the go-to beverage for celebrating success in sports.

results.title: A Once Lowly Program Gets a Second Shot at the Top
results.abstract: San Diego State was poised for a top seed in the 2020 N.C.A.A. tournament before the pandemic led to its cancellation. This year’s team, with three key holdovers, has made a run to the Final Four.

multimedia.caption: San Diego State players celebrating with fans after beating Creighton to reach the men’s Final Four.
San Diego State players celebrating with fans after beating Creighton to reach the men’s Final Four.
San Diego State players celebrating with fans after beating Creighton to reach the men’s Final Four.

results.title: The Beach Boys Making a Final Four Run
results.abstract: Florida Atlantic has seemingly come out of nowhere to make a deep run in the men’s N.C.A.A. tournament. The university’s ambitions are relatively young, too.

multimedia.caption: One of the breakout teams in this year’s N.C.A.A. men’s basketball tournament has been ninth-seeded Florida Atlantic, a university that has only been around since the 1960s and that has only had a men’s basketball team since 1988.

results.title: The ChatGPT King Isn’t Worried, but He Knows You Might Be
results.abstract: Sam Altman sees the pros and cons of totally changing the world as we know it. And if he does make human intelligence useless, he has a plan to fix it.

results.title: Thailand’s Unemployed Elephants Are Back Home, Huge and Hungry
results.abstract: When the tourists who rode them disappeared from resort destinations, Thailand’s captive elephants, and their owners, went back to their birth villages, where finding enough food has been a struggle.
results.byline: By Muktita Suhartono and Ulet Ifansasti

multimedia.caption: Elephants are a common sight on the streets of Baan Ta Klang village, in Thailand. Here, a mahout rides his elephant past a sculpture of a mythical, multiheaded elephant in February.
multimedia.copyright: Ulet Ifansasti for The New York Times
